paper.title: A Microeconomic View of Data Mining

author.org: Department of Computer Science, Cornell University, Ithaca, NY 14853. kleinber@cs.cornell.edu#TAB#
Computer Science Division, Soda Hall, UC Berkeley, CA 94720. christos@cs.berkeley.edu#TAB#

paper.abstract: We present a rigorous framework, based on optimization, for evaluating data mining operations such as associations and clustering, in terms of their utility in decision-making. This framework leads quickly to some interesting computational problems related to sensitivity analysis, segmentation and the theory of games.
